title: Air Cargo News | The latest airport cargo news and updates
content:
Hong Kong International has reopened its North Runway following repairs after a 747 freighter veered off the runway into the sea, killing two airport security workers

Frankfurt Airport recorded modest cargo growth in September despite regional disparities, with Asia Pacific routes offsetting declines in North America and Latin America

Munich Airport has achieved a 10% increase in air cargo volumes over six months, handling 182,000 tons between March and October

Bangladesh authorities have launched an investigation into a major cargo area fire at Hazrat Shahjalal International Airport

Beijing Capital Airlines has commenced A330P2F operations between Zhengzhou Xinzheng International Airport and Glasgow Prestwick Airport

Brussels Airport has officially opened its €70m Brucargo Central redevelopment, delivering 30% increased cargo storage capacity through three modern warehouses

Liège Airport posted a 23% year-on-year increase in cargo volumes during the third quarter, reaching 334,956 tonnes as both import and export flows strengthened

Ostend-Bruges Airport has appointed Johan Leunen as cargo development director to strengthen air cargo operations and generate new business

Avianca Cargo has launched twice-weekly A330 freighter flights to Maastricht Aachen Airport, targeting South American flower imports

Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky International Airport has marked the first development at its Global Logistics Park with F&F's 80,000 sq ft air cargo facility

Federal Express has launched its first automated sorting facility at Tallinn airport, tripling capacity to 3,000 parcels per hour as Estonia's e-commerce sector grows 20% annually to reach €5 billion turnover.

The UK Government has approved Gatwick Airport's plans to operationalise its northern runway and Logistics UK has highlighted the benefits for cargo

DHL Express has opened a €80m international hub at Barcelona Airport, featuring automated sorting systems capable of processing 20,000 parcels per hour

FedEx has commissioned a 19,000 sq ft cargo handling facility at East Midlands Airport, operating independently from existing parcel operations

Madrid-based air cargo and wet-lease operator Swiftair Group has agreed to sell a majority stake to investment firm Antin Infrastructure Partners

IATA has reported that air cargo demand increased for the sixth consecutive month, showing "resilience in a challenging global economic context"
